verses.plain: I made a covenant with mine eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?

tokens.t: I made a covenant with mine eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?

verses.plain: For what portion of God is there from above? and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?

tokens.t: For what portion of God
from above? and
inheritance of the Almighty from on high?

verses.plain: Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?

tokens.t: not destruction to the wicked? and a strange
to the workers of iniquity?

verses.plain: Doth not he see my ways, and count all my steps?

tokens.t: Doth not he see my ways, and count all my steps?

verses.plain: If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;

tokens.t: If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;

verses.plain: Let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know mine integrity.

tokens.t: Let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know mine integrity.

verses.plain: If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands;

tokens.t: If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands;

verses.plain: Then let me sow, and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.

tokens.t: let me sow, and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.

verses.plain: If mine heart have been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbour’s door;

tokens.t: If mine heart have been deceived by a woman, or
I have laid wait at my neighbour’s door;

verses.plain: Then let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon her.

tokens.t: let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon her.

verses.plain: For this is an heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.

tokens.t: For this
an heinous crime; yea, it
an iniquity
the judges.

verses.plain: For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.

tokens.t: For it
a fire
consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.

verses.plain: If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant, when they contended with me;

tokens.t: If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant, when they contended with me;

verses.plain: What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?

tokens.t: What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?

verses.plain: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb?

tokens.t: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb?

verses.plain: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;

tokens.t: If I have withheld the poor from
desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;

verses.plain: Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof;

tokens.t: Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof;

verses.plain: (For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother’s womb;)

tokens.t: (For from my youth he was brought up with me, as
a father, and I have guided her from my mother’s womb;)

verses.plain: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;

tokens.t: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;

verses.plain: If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;

tokens.t: If his loins have not blessed me, and
he were
warmed with the fleece of my sheep;

verses.plain: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:

tokens.t: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:

verses.plain: Then let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone.

tokens.t: let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone.

verses.plain: For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.

tokens.t: For destruction
God
a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.

verses.plain: If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;

tokens.t: If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold,
my confidence;

verses.plain: If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much;

tokens.t: If I rejoiced because my wealth
great, and because mine hand had gotten much;

verses.plain: If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness;

tokens.t: If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking
brightness;

verses.plain: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand:

tokens.t: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand:

verses.plain: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.

tokens.t: This also
an iniquity
the judge: for I should have denied the God
above.

verses.plain: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:

tokens.t: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:

verses.plain: Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.

tokens.t: Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.

verses.plain: If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.

tokens.t: If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.

verses.plain: The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the traveller.

tokens.t: The stranger did not lodge in the street:
I opened my doors to the traveller.

verses.plain: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom:

tokens.t: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom:

verses.plain: Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and went not out of the door?

tokens.t: Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence,
went not out of the door?

verses.plain: Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that mine adversary had written a book.

tokens.t: Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire
the Almighty would answer me, and
mine adversary had written a book.

verses.plain: Surely I would take it upon my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.

tokens.t: Surely I would take it upon my shoulder,
bind it
a crown to me.

verses.plain: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto him.

tokens.t: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto him.

verses.plain: If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain;

tokens.t: If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain;

verses.plain: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:

tokens.t: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:

verses.plain: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.

tokens.t: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.

footnotes.text: Let…: Heb. Let him weigh me in balances of justice
did not one…: or, did he not fashion us in one womb?
my mouth…: Heb. my hand hath kissed my mouth
as Adam: or, after the manner of men
my…: or, my sign is that the Almighty will
the owners…: Heb. the soul of the owners thereof to expire, or, breathe out
